commitResults.messageTitle: Add REPL to process user input Echoes all user commands except "bye" which terminates the program.
Update divider text This is done to customize the chatbot.
Add ability to store and list text
Move logo display string into greet()
commitResults.messageBody:
Greeting logo string is in the main function, which has similar
functionality as greet().

This groups the greetings into a single function for improved
readability in the main function.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add the ability to mark tasks as done
commitResults.messageBody:
Tasks are represented by strings stored in an array.

Functionality and data of tasks are separated and hard to extend.

Abstracting each task into the Task class allows functionality to be
grouped with data. This improves code readability and makes it easier
to add tasks related features.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update code to comply with standard

commitResults.messageBody:
There are instances where Task needs to be printed with
the same formatting.

By using overriding toString() method, the string's formatting is
refactored to a single function in the codebase.

This reduces code duplication and enhances code readability,
allowing it to be modified from a single function in the code.
It can also be overridden by subclasses for different formatting.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add support for tracking three types of tasks.
commitResults.messageBody:
Task is being used to to track user's tasks.

There may be different types of tasks that users want to store,
such as todos, deadlines and events.

Three different types of tasks are added as subclasses to Task.
These classes are Todo, Deadline and Event, which has additional
properties to track additional information about these Tasks.

Polymorphic code allows us to use a single collection to store
all the user's Tasks, and use the call the same methods, thus
simplifying the code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add automated text UI testing with I/O redirection
commitResults.messageBody:
Symbols that indicate status icons for Tasks are emojis, which
caused encoding errors in testing output.

The symbols have been replaced with other characters to remove
the cause of these errors.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update REPL to use switch statement for commands
commitResults.messageBody:
The loop uses if-else statements to match user commands. As
more commands are added, the structure starts to become messy.

Using a switch statement to match the first word allows us to label
each part of the code more clearly to improve code readability.

Expected test output was also updated to match the
updated print statement.

commitResults.messageTitle: Move Task related functionality into TaskManager
commitResults.messageBody:
Both REPL and Task related functionality and data exists in the Duke
class, making the code disorganized.

Task related functionality and data has been abstracted into
TaskManager, which manages all Task functionality, such as adding
Tasks.

By abstracting code into Task Manager, the main function is cleaned
up and related functionality is grouped into a single class.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor max tasks size as a constant
